channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Breaking News: A third of Americans live in areas with such high Covid levels now that they should consider wearing masks indoors whether local leaders require it or not, U.S. health officials warned. https://t.co/emLWdlZ7eN
Breaking News: Turkey blocked NATO’s initial effort to fast-track Finland’s and Sweden’s applications to join the alliance, according to a senior diplomat. https://t.co/WTrg4uwz1U

Breaking News: A Russian soldier pleaded guilty in Kyiv to shooting a civilian, in the first Ukrainian trial over a potential war crime since Russia’s invasion.
Asked if he accepted his guilt, the soldier said: “Yes. Fully yes.” https://t.co/9Wd9cE0jdI

About 30 minutes before he opened fire at a Buffalo supermarket, the gunman in Saturday's shooting invited a small group of people to join a chat room on Discord where he had spent months planning the massacre. No one appeared to have alerted the police. https://t.co/DPvK99gZr3

Finland and Sweden formally asked to join NATO on Wednesday after decades of strategic neutrality. Both countries have seen public opinion tilt heavily in favor of becoming members of the alliance since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/CRT6Apj4pm https://t.co/3eosqhkaEG

It’s difficult to catch Asian elephants responding to deaths of herd members in the wild. So researchers turned to YouTube.
Videos showed the animals touching or trying to lift carcasses. Often, the elephants kept a kind of vigil over their fallen peers. https://t.co/rz1QaUqBAq

Rep. Madison Cawthorn lost the Republican primary in North Carolina's 11th District on Tuesday. The outcome served as a rebuke of Cawthorn, a right-wing firebrand and the youngest freshman in Congress, who was once seen as a rising Republican star. https://t.co/S6b2efK3dl https://t.co/Q5xw0VEoZX
Kaja Kallas, Estonia’s prime minister, remembers life under Soviet occupation. She has become one of Europe’s toughest voices against Russia for its war in Ukraine. https://t.co/FjA8fjsmmY

President Biden paid tribute to each of the victims of the racist massacre in Buffalo. He choked up as he said one of the victims was a father visiting the supermarket to buy a birthday cake for his 3-year-old son.
"Evil will not win, I promise you." https://t.co/umNDlTv50W

A military analyst on Russian state television left other panelists in stunned silence when he said that the conflict in Ukraine was deteriorating for Russia, giving the kind of honest assessment that is virtually banished from the official airwaves. https://t.co/bnhNCRplOR

Breaking News: Finland and Sweden formally asked to join NATO, casting aside decades of neutrality after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine upended European security.
https://t.co/LbLHJdVr5K

Hundreds of Ukrainian soldiers who made a last stand against Russian forces from a Mariupol steel mill faced an uncertain future Tuesday under Kremlin custody. They were transported to Russian-held territory aboard buses emblazoned with “Z." https://t.co/cfXE2DKpvW

Biniam Girmay of Eritrea became the first Black African cyclist to win a stage of one of the Grand Tours. “It’s unbelievable,” he said after he won the 10th stage of the Giro d’Italia. https://t.co/J6W2DEOupt

President Biden condemned the racist rhetoric that reportedly influenced a white man to gun down Black shoppers at the Tops supermarket in Buffalo. “What happened here is simple and straightforward: Terrorism. Terrorism. Domestic terrorism,” Biden said. https://t.co/7PQuMUnLXs https://t.co/xGFlqAMCmD
Breaking News: Rep. Madison Cawthorn lost his Republican primary in North Carolina after a series of incendiary statements and scandals soured many former supporters. https://t.co/Gii86HK9gh

Christian Cooper is perhaps best known for his encounter in Central Park with a white woman who called 911 to falsely accuse him of threatening her. Now, he'll be back in the public eye — this time hosting a new show for National Geographic. https://t.co/tXjrBmTu6h

Jeff Jackson, a Democratic state senator who suspended his U.S. Senate campaign in late 2021, won his party’s primary nomination for North Carolina’s newly added 14th Congressional District. https://t.co/gSpmGnb8dq

Josh Shapiro, the Pennsylvania state attorney general, won the Democratic nomination for governor. With a Republican-controlled legislature, he has pledged to veto abortion ban bills. https://t.co/Z2KGF8mkh1

President Biden delivered a speech in Buffalo on Tuesday denouncing the attack that killed 10 people as a racist act of terror. Many Black residents of the area said that the address would ultimately mean little without further action. https://t.co/IqyM9NGpYI https://t.co/EgKr9ZWDCB

Rep. Madison Cawthorn has lost the Republican primary in North Carolina's 11th District. The outcome served as a rebuke of Cawthorn, a right-wing firebrand and the youngest freshman in Congress, who was once seen as a rising star of the Republican Party. https://t.co/p7TzENNzmI https://t.co/DljzbYqajf

The leaders of Finland and Sweden confirmed on Tuesday that they would jointly submit their applications for NATO membership this week, in a coordinated decision to end decades of neutrality amid Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/qjuOy6EcGd https://t.co/N9OOA6Q1Zw

Breaking News: The Justice Department accused the former casino mogul Steve Wynn of lobbying Donald Trump on behalf of the Chinese government and sought to force Wynn to register as a foreign agent. https://t.co/eps2U5ocHN

John Fetterman, the Democratic lieutenant governor of Pennsylvania, won his party’s Senate nomination on Tuesday. The result sets the stage for a fierce general election battle in a state that could determine control of the chamber. https://t.co/YGKMmSwr7W https://t.co/RmF72dju4p
Lt. Gov. John Fetterman, a progressive with blue-collar appeal, won the Democratic Senate primary in Pennsylvania just days after suffering a stroke. https://t.co/CKvrt6Oxt3

Spain on Tuesday approved a draft law that would make it the first European country to grant women days off work because of severe menstrual pain. It would also extend access to abortion, allowing the procedure from the age of 16 without parental consent. https://t.co/pONkkyFw4z https://t.co/ttn32TsNz6

“White supremacy is a poison,” President Biden said in Buffalo on Tuesday. “We need to say as clearly and forcefully as we can that the ideology of white supremacy has no place in America. None.”
Read a transcript of his speech. https://t.co/Erpx6jHh7B

Breaking News: The Justice Department is said to have asked the House panel investigating Jan. 6 for transcripts, which could be used as evidence in potential criminal cases or to pursue new leads. https://t.co/i8Xzv0Y9Sr

In the first lawsuit of its kind, two real Electoral College delegates in Wisconsin are seeking damages from 10 fake ones who tried to help Donald Trump in 2020 overturn his defeat in the state. https://t.co/yU4GnKWEyK

Spain approved a draft law on Tuesday that would grant women paid time off from work because of severe menstrual pain. The new law, the first of its kind in Europe if it passes, would also extend access to abortion. https://t.co/t3DaugA6cQ

Leaders of Finland and Sweden confirmed on Tuesday that the Nordic nations would jointly submit their applications for NATO membership this week, and would travel to Washington to meet with President Biden. https://t.co/pFz6i53mXO

Senator Chuck Schumer sent a letter to Fox News executives calling on it to take responsibility for spreading harmful and racist rhetoric and to "immediately cease the reckless amplification of the so-called 'Great Replacement' theory." https://t.co/Lg2jLJ2BO7

Breaking News: In an emotional speech in Buffalo, President Biden denounced Saturday’s shooting as racist terrorism and criticized the use of hate speech for political gain. https://t.co/NLJhG9oGC5 https://t.co/mp4AsWqWZe

Senator Chuck Schumer on Monday reprimanded hard-right Republicans, along with Fox News and pundit Tucker Carlson, for amplifying the white supremacist “replacement theory” that motivated the mass shooter who killed 10 Black people in Buffalo on Saturday. https://t.co/abge2mLmR7

A House subcommittee has opened a hearing on unidentified aerial phenomena observed by military pilots and others. A government report last year cataloged 143 reports of unexplained aerial phenomena dating to 2004. https://t.co/fodDTbqiZB https://t.co/Dyr3heNqIg

Sweden’s foreign minister signed her country’s application to join NATO.
“It feels momentous,” she said, “and it feels like we now have reached what we think is best for Sweden.” https://t.co/PrpnVrBpTW https://t.co/NjgIf9IOof
Elon Musk said his $44 billion acquisition of Twitter "cannot move forward" until he gets more details about the volume of spam and fake accounts on the platform. https://t.co/dAiLaypS8Y

In Opinion
“Replacement theory is an attack on democracy,” writes the editorial board. “It privileges the purported interests of some Americans over those of others, asserting, in effect, that the will of the people means the will of white people.” https://t.co/uOI4TGxxRl
Breaking News: Ukraine ended its “combat mission” in Mariupol and said fighters were being evacuated, signaling that the battle at a steel plant was over. https://t.co/XWTQLrzzLG

Officials on Monday strongly recommended that New Yorkers wear medical-grade masks in offices, grocery stores and other public indoor settings, stopping short of a mandate as the city approaches a "high" alert level for Covid-19. https://t.co/3GOBBeQA4r

In the past decade, hate crimes against Black Americans, who are 12% of the population, have far exceeded those reported against any other group, federal data shows. In 2020, more than half of the victims of hate crimes based on race were Black people. https://t.co/mHATWSO6Zc
Blood moon. Flower moon. Total eclipse. Whatever you called it, Earth’s shadow draped over the moon Sunday. Here are some photos of what it looked like around the world. https://t.co/oJpCVgT9fG

After the deadly mass shooting in Buffalo, Representative Elise Stefanik, Republican of New York, is facing scrutiny for echoing the racist “great replacement” theory in campaign advertisements. https://t.co/1yJfttFUe2

Russian forces in Ukraine have underperformed to a degree that has surprised most Western analysts, raising the prospect that President Vladimir Putin’s military operation could end in failure. https://t.co/5uLd3Hehz8

Among the victims of Saturday's mass shooting in Buffalo was Andre Mackniel, who was headed to the Tops grocery store for a birthday cake, chips and soda for his 3-year-old son. “He was a loving father,” his fiancée, Tracey Maciulewicz, said. https://t.co/ciEQwuxnzs

The coronavirus has become more adept at reinfecting people as Omicron and its many descendants seem to have evolved to partially dodge immunity. Waves of infections two, maybe three times a year may be the future of Covid-19, some scientists now fear. https://t.co/FbS9z8mTe8

An undocumented Mexican woman, an undocumented Mexican immigrant, a Lebanese student and an American-born Syrian: They aided investigators after the worst subway attack in decades. Now, they're seeking protection from the nation’s immigration system. https://t.co/iK2yUOpfnj

"You expect us to keep doing this over and over again, forgive and forget," said Garnell Whitfield, a former fire commissioner who lost his mother, Ruth Whitfield, in Saturday's mass shooting in Buffalo. https://t.co/tv6JKjSXuT https://t.co/6Ev0vaUlzq

Australia’s Covid death rate sits at one-tenth of America’s, putting the nation of 25 million people near the top of global rankings in the protection of life. Both countries share similar demographics, but their rates point to different cultures of trust. https://t.co/VQwzMwytVB

Katherine Massey, one of the victims of the mass shooting at a Tops supermarket in Buffalo on Saturday, wrote several commanding letters in local Buffalo publications urging stronger gun control laws. https://t.co/vB6n4JBUEK

At the start of the pandemic, few could imagine that one million people in the U.S. would be lost. It’s a staggering total that struck every corner of the country. But it did not strike evenly. https://t.co/8ht2v7Trxj https://t.co/0BfxVxiPjp
